perturbation.original_text: This Manifest System Services and Co-Branding Agreement ("Agreement") is                                                                --------- made and entered into as of April 27, 1999 (the "Effective Date"), by and                                                  -------------- between iShip.com, Inc., a Washington corporation (the "Company"), and Mail                                                         ------- Boxes Etc. USA, Inc., a California corporation ("MBE").                                                  ---
perturbation.changed_text: This Manifest System Services and Co-Branding Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of April 27, 1999 (the "Effective Date"), by and between iShip.com, Inc., a Washington corporation (the "Corporation"), and Mail Boxes Etc. USA, Inc., a California corporation ("MBE").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Company' is changed to 'Corporation'. This introduces ambiguity as to whether 'Company' and 'Corporation' refer to the same entity throughout the agreement, especially in sections referring to obligations of 'the Company'.

perturbation.original_text: (p) "MBE Center" shall mean each franchise of MBE operating a franchise           ---------- retail outlet within the United States which enters into a Subscription Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: (p) "MBE Center" shall mean each franchise of MBE operating a franchise retail outlet within the United States which enters into a User Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The term "Subscription Agreement" is changed to "User Agreement". The contract uses the term 'Subscription Agreement' in other sections to define the obligations of the MBE Centers. This change creates uncertainty on which agreement is to be used and which terms and conditions apply.

perturbation.original_text: (a) Updates and Service Revisions. The Company will make Updates to the          ----------------------------- Service in accordance with the requirements set forth in the Specifications at no charge for the entire term of this Agreement. Without limiting the foregoing, the Service shall be updated from time to time during the term of this Agreement to include accurate and current (i) Listings and (ii) pricing and service descriptions for each carrier supported by the Manifest, in each case as soon as reasonably practicable following the receipt by the Company of such Listings, pricing and service descriptions. As reasonably necessary, the Company shall update the Specifications to reflect such Updates and shall provide a copy of same to MBE at least once per calendar quarter. If the Company develops additional Intellectual Property Rights that are made available without development charge to other customers of the Company, the Company will also make such Intellectual Property Rights available to MBE without development charge.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) Updates and Service Revisions. The Company will make Modifications to the Service in accordance with the requirements set forth in the Specifications at no charge for the entire term of this Agreement. Without limiting the foregoing, the Service shall be updated from time to time during the term of this Agreement to include accurate and current (i) Listings and (ii) pricing and service descriptions for each carrier supported by the Manifest, in each case as soon as reasonably practicable following the receipt by the Company of such Listings, pricing and service descriptions. As reasonably necessary, the Company shall update the Specifications to reflect such Modifications and shall provide a copy of same to MBE at least once per calendar quarter. If the Company develops additional Intellectual Property Rights that are made available without development charge to other customers of the Company, the Company will also make such Intellectual Property Rights available to MBE without development charge.
perturbation.explanation: The term "Updates" is changed to "Modifications". In Section 4(a), the term 'Updates' is used to describe bug fixes, error corrections, and maintenance updates of the Service. By changing it to 'Modifications,' and not defining 'Modifications,' it is now unclear if the Company is obligated to provide the same level of bug fixes and error corrections that it was previously obligated to provide under 'Updates,' creating a contradiction and possible dispute.
